Posted By: Demento_Recraves (9/26/2012 2:33:53 AM)

posts.post_content: Everyone knows the power of [Grim Lavamancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Lavamancer) in getting the last points of damage through for cheap in mono red decks by recycling already spent cards in the graveyard. This card does it one card *cheaper*, uses *any* graveyard and not just the graveyard of its controller, and can be played in not one but *two* different deck colors.
posts.html:
Everyone knows the power of Grim Lavamancer in getting the last points of damage through for cheap in mono red decks by recycling already spent cards in the graveyard. This card does it one card cheaper, uses any graveyard and not just the graveyard of its controller, and can be played in not one but two different deck colors.

posts.post_content: So good. Especailly in formats with fetchlands. It just does everything. Gains life, add mana, hurts your opponent, eats reanimation tagets, eats [Spapcaster Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spapcaster Mage) targets and eats fetchlands, which can make this work like a mono-black [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise). It also isn't bad without fetchlands, it puts a clock on your opponent or keeps you alive, that's not to be sneered at.
posts.html:

Posted By: DacenOctavio (11/11/2012 12:16:49 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@darkrai88  
  
You need a target for each of the 3 abilities. If there are no instants, sorceries, creatures or lands in a graveyard none of the abilities have a legal target to be activated. So no, you can't just tap and cause 2 life lose.
posts.html:
@darkrai88

You need a target for each of the 3 abilities. If there are no instants, sorceries, creatures or lands in a graveyard none of the abilities have a legal target to be activated. So no, you can't just tap and cause 2 life lose.

Posted By: Lord_Sauron (12/11/2012 8:32:00 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I see lots of mentions of [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise) meets [Grim Lavamancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Lavamancer), but why not toss all three of them into a land destruction deck? [Poison the Well](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Poison the Well), [Drain the Well](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drain the Well), [Avalanche Riders](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avalanche Riders). Use [Abrupt Decay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abrupt Decay) for a bit of control as needed. Nickle & Dime them as you kill their lands or finish them off with something big like [Vraska](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vraska)  
  
This card is a ridiculous powerhouse in the right deck while still being really strong in most decks.
posts.html:
I see lots of mentions of Birds of Paradise meets Grim Lavamancer, but why not toss all three of them into a land destruction deck? Poison the Well, Drain the Well, Avalanche Riders. Use Abrupt Decay for a bit of control as needed. Nickle & Dime them as you kill their lands or finish them off with something big like Vraska

This card is a ridiculous powerhouse in the right deck while still being really strong in most decks.

posts.post_content:
This card in a nutshell:  
Limited Player: "Oh my gosh, this card does everything!" \*tables the card immediately\*  
Standard Player: "Hey look, I found another [grim lavamancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=grim lavamancer), but, in black? And look I can ramp into turn 2 [Geralf's Messenger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geralf's Messenger) with [Ghost Quarter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghost Quarter). How neat!"  
Modern Player: "Goyf hate and Snapcaster Hate that comes down before snapcaster or goyf. Wow, cool 1 drop fits right into my jund deck."  
Leagacy Player: "Eh, it's something to do with the cards I pitch to [force of will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=force of will). I guess it's good."  
Vintage Player: "But, it's not [mox lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mox lotus)! \*flips table\*" (just kidding, most vintage players aren't like that.)  
  
5/5   
This card is a home run imo. Draft with it, play it in sealed, maybe in standard if you can get it to work, definitely play it in modern, and maybe even play it in legacy if you need another [grim lavamancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=grim lavamancer). This card literally does ev... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
